From what I recall, it states that each level of trophic food chain (like from plants to mice to skunks to wolves) loses approximately 90% of its energy at each step because about 10% is transferred to the next level. So, for example, if plants give out X calories, mice might get around 0.9X, and skunks could get another 0.9 of that, which would be 0.81X, and so on. The question is asking how much energy the wolf gets directly from the clover plants.
